hypothesis_content.title: Neutral Regime Volatility Squeeze Breakout with Volume Confirmation
hypothesis_content.statement: During NEUTRAL regimes (confidence > 55%), when BTC's 20-day Bollinger Band width contracts to its 30-day low (volatility squeeze), a subsequent daily close above the upper Bollinger Band with volume > 1.5x 20-day average will lead to a directional breakout with a 3:1 reward/risk profile over the next 5-7 days.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Neutral regimes often precede volatility expansions. A squeeze indicates compression of trading ranges, creating potential energy. Volume confirmation filters false breakouts. The 3:1 R/R targets the typical expansion magnitude after prolonged compression.
entry_conditions: BTC 20-day BB width < 30-day low of BB width
BTC daily close > upper Bollinger Band (20,2)

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price reaches 2.5x the BB width at entry (measured from upper band)
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price closes back inside BB (below upper band)
exit_conditions.time_exit: 7 days after entry if neither TP nor SL hit

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 60% of such signals result in immediate reversal (close back inside BB within 2 days) or fail to reach 1.5x BB width target over 7 days.
